intro: Praravinia lucbanensis, commonly known as the Lucban violet, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture. Praravinia lucbanensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique floral structure.
